Uses of Interface
org.jsimpledb.JObject

  • Packages that use JObject 
    Package Description
    org.jsimpledb
    Abstraction layer allowing access to a Database using normal Java objects.

    • Uses of JObject in org.jsimpledb

      Methods in org.jsimpledb that return JObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JObject JSimpleDB.getJObject(ObjId id)
      Get the Java object used to represent the given object ID.
      JObject ValidationException.getObject()
      Get the object that failed to validate.
      Methods in org.jsimpledb that return types with arguments of type JObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<ConstraintViolation<JObject>> ValidationException.getViolations()
      Get the validation errors in case validation failed due to a failed JSR 303 validation check.
      Methods in org.jsimpledb with parameters of type JObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean JTransaction.delete(JObject jobj)
      Delete the given instance in this transaction.
      boolean JTransaction.exists(JObject jobj)
      Determine whether the given instance exists in this transaction.
      byte[] JTransaction.getKey(JObject jobj)
      Get the byte[] key in the underlying key/value store corresponding to the specified object.
      byte[] JTransaction.getKey(JObject jobj, String path)
      Get the byte[] key in the underlying key/value store corresponding to the specified field in the specified object.
      boolean JTransaction.recreate(JObject jobj)
      Recreate the given instance in this transaction.
      void JTransaction.revalidate(JObject jobj)
      Add the given instance to the validation queue for validation, which will occur either at JTransaction.commit() time or at the next invocation of JTransaction.validate(), whichever occurs first.
      boolean JTransaction.updateSchemaVersion(JObject jobj)
      Update the schema version of the specified object, if necessary, so that its version matches the schema version associated with this JSimpleDB.
      Method parameters in org.jsimpledb with type arguments of type JObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> NavigableSet<T> JTransaction.invertReferencePath(Class<T> startType, String path, Iterable<? extends JObject> targetObjects)
      Find all objects that refer to any object in the given target set through the specified path of references.

      Constructor and Description

      Constructor.
      ValidationException(JObject jobj, String message)
      Convenience constructor for use when JSR 303 validation is not involved.
